title: Design and Implementation of Online Focus Group Interviews for Large-Scale Veterinary Education Research: Enhancing Social Interaction and Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online meeting tools, general comprehension of veterinary concepts, fundamental statistical knowledge for social relationship analysis.
context.additional_context: A simulation environment where learners, consisting of working professionals, practice operating online focus groups required for veterinary education research. Acquire data collection techniques using Zoom's annotation features and others. Particularly emphasizes interview design and data interpretation methods considering institutional characteristics and stakeholder relationship analysis in veterinary education settings.

learning_goals: Learners will design an online focus group interview questionnaire aligned with veterinary medical education research objectives and construct open-ended questions that facilitate social interaction among participants.
Learners will apply techniques to promote collaborative relationships and interactions among participants using annotation features in digital video conferencing platforms.

Learners will systematically classify qualitative and quantitative data collected from online focus group interviews and explain analytical methods reflecting the cultural and economic contexts of veterinary medical education settings.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
